instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Trackpad or Keyboard after Backlight repair
threads.message:
I have an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that came in fully functional except for backlight. Trackpad & keyboard definitely worked.

I found corrosion all around <CHIP>U7701</CHIP>, which was badly damaged at Pin 5 (<SIGNAL>PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT_FB</SIGNAL>). I replaced the driver which fixed the backlight, but now the trackpad/kb are completely inop. I have checked for damage to the cable and the connector. The rest of the board looks clean as well, like a single drop of water went straight to the backlight driver and killed it.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Trackpad or Keyboard after Backlight repair
threads.message:
What voltage do you get on pin 10, 14, and 19 of J4800?

After that, the magical question: if you hold down the option key upon turning it on, do you get to the screen where you can select a boot device? Do trackpad & keyboard work here in this screen? Can you hit left & right to select other boot devices and move the cursor around and click them? If so, I leave this for duke. :D

I'm also assuming you already tried another flat cable/trackpad/keyboard at this point that are known good.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Trackpad or Keyboard after Backlight repair
threads.message:
[B][U]J4800[/U]
Pin 10:[/B] 3.32V
[B]Pin 14:[/B] 5.10V
[B]Pin 19:[/B] 3.40V

Option boot works, can use trackpad & kb here just fine. Tested arrows, wifi login, etc

I have not tested another cable, trackpad, or kb due to lack of testable parts. Seems these are probably OK though since they work in the Option boot menu?

EDIT:

OK since measuring the kb connector pins and letting it sit in the option menu to think about its life for a few minutes, I rebooted it normally and everything works. Mark this one solved i guess? This one [I]definitely [/I]won't come back. Nope. Not a chance.
